definition: to cut off/to interrupt/to prevent access
to cover up (a shortcoming)/to screen off/to hide/to conceal
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: But battlefield air interdiction is not so crisply defined.
sentences.chinese: 而对于战场空中遮断的定义并不像这样容易。

sentences.english: It is the executing agency Emergency Trip slide valve.
sentences.chinese: 它的执行机构是危急遮断滑阀。

sentences.english: The mountain roads were obstructed by falling rocks.
sentences.chinese: 山路被落下的岩石所遮断。

sentences.english: These new buildings will interrupt our view of the sea.
sentences.chinese: 这些新楼房将会遮断我们的视野。

sentences.english: When the light interdictions, will be issued a warning.
sentences.chinese: 当光线被遮断时就会发出警报。

sentences.english: He thought citizen's sight would be covered by the snow which has been snowing all day.
sentences.chinese: 他在想，这雪会一直下，市民们的视野会被遮断的。

sentences.english: The wall cuts across our line of vision.

definition: to cover/to hide from view/to obstruct or block/defilade (military)
raid/to carry out a raid/to invade
to break or cut in two/to sever/to cut off/(fig.) to cut off (a conversation, a flow etc)/to interrupt/(math.) to truncate
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
to gaze afar/to look into the distance
deep and somber/see also 窈窈[yao3 yao3]
